intro: Sventenia bupleuroides, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, sky-blue to white flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate, airy appearance. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Sventenia bupleuroides is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
